1604200104_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
> [mg0](#comment_378_1LbP2cNA6NkvuFJvs7McUmv9qGjkNqVkTa): but would only get my millchan posts if you ever download millchan. [...]

I think Millchan and 08Chan uses separate certs, not ZeroID etc.. AFAIK the follower would have to know the identity behind the "random" cert to connect it to you.

I like the idea.

1604219688_15HwpjShZKp2dpMuZqFaariQtJvMa.body:
ZeroTalk++, no doubt. I don't know about the technical aspects of ZN so I can only talk from a user perspective - But ZN sorely needs de facto standard and cloneable zites so users can easily start creating their own content and spaces.

Look at ZeroBlog++, straight up working out of the box. Now I have a blog!

Regular ZeroTalk is a rudimentary proof-of-concept forum. Get the karma-voting up and running on ZT++ and we're nearly at a working competitor to reddit-style social media aggregators - Which I would call a ZN killer zite!

If there weren't a warning on ZT++ I would have started using it as soon as I found it as it is seemingly the best forum platform on ZN.

> [styromaniac](#comment_2650_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): Secondarily, an improved ZeroMe, ZeroMe++, if you will.[...]

ZM have a lot of viable replacements already, with ZeroMe Reloaded and Sakana being my two favorites. IMO the twitter clone system works well as is, it would be nice to have a "suite" of ++ apps, ZM++ included but why not focus on the nearly complete ZT++ first?
